intro: Xyochlaena monachne var. minor, commonly known as the lesser monastic broom, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Rhamnaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, clustered yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly serrated margin. This variety is less common than its parent species and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and clearings.
